text: among the players to watch it this
year's US Open is 28 year-old John Isner
at 6 feet 10 inches this American player
crushed his second serve returns with
his forehand his nurse kick serve and
his improved quickness and movement make
him capable of beating any player in the
tournament on the women's side 28 year
old yelena Yankovich of Serbia has
beefed up her forehand and begun
attacking the net on short balls she has
also added a drop shot to keep opponent
off balance Jankovic has always been
tough to beat but now she has added
power to her consistency 24 year old
Juan mart√≠n del potro of argentina has
the most powerful ground game in men's
tennis at 67 del Potro serves cannons
his favorite weapon is his flat four
hand and his two-handed backhand is rock
solid del Potro beat Roger Federer in
2009 to win the US Open but a series of
injuries derailed his career the high
level of play between del Potro and
Novak Djokovic at this year's Wimbledon
semifinals showed that they'll Potro was
back at the top of his game dominika
cibulkova of slovakia is built like a
gymnast with a powerful lower body that
helps her cover the court the 24 year
old has one of the quickest first steps
in tennis as well as the blistering
forehand she uses her speed to go on the
offensive at every opportunity playing
energetic up-tempo tennis although 22
year-old Grigor Dimitrov of Bulgaria
will be a low see that this year's open
his games clearly modeled on Roger
Federer's with the flowing one-handed
backhand and a dominating forehand
and in addition to her powerful all
court game twenty-year-old Sloane
Stephens knows how to grind out a tough
win even when she's not playing her best
this American player has the speed the
power and the mentality to go deep into
the second week a crowd favorite at
Flushing Meadows Stephens loves the big
stage
